date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
text: TL;DR It works and I am kicking myself for not continuing my maintenance of a pill a day for a year.I have had kidney stones practically my entire adult life, producing one every 4 to 6 months. 3 years ago my pattern changed tho. It switched from my left kidney to my right and after it switched sides, I only produced a single stone the first time then the pain of passing a stone was occurring every few weeks. After a while I would produce bloody urine frequently and I finally got a CT scan to confirm what I feared. a 2cm stone was in my right kidney. The nephrologist said "your kidney is functioning in normal levels" so they didn't suggest doing anything about it and I'm seriously dumbfounded, because of the amount of pain I was in. Pain makes us think differently, My next step was to figure out a way to make a DIY lithotripsy machine. Luckily I found the stonebreaker chanca piedra. Within a month I was back to feeling normal and I decided to take a bottle's worth of 1 pill a day as maintenance. I ran out and felt fine so I didn't get a new bottle. 1 year later, I bought another bottle as I passed a small stone.This stuff truly is amazing. It works at least for the uric acid based stones which is what I produced.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2018
text: I suffer from a kidney stone disorder called MSK and for years I've looked for something, anything, that could help break down the stones and help them pass easier. I've altered my diet, take suppliments and drink enough water to fill a swimming pool but nothing seemed to help me as much as Chanca Piedra. I happened to stumble upon an article about it and thought I'd give it a try. After going through a few different, pricier, brands I finally found the Alerna brand. This is straight Chanca Piedra. No mixes, no fillers nothing extra to get in the way or give the manufacturer an excuse to charge a ridiculous made up price for something that doesn't work. I've been taking it now for a few months and have noticed a distinct difference in my kidney stone output as well as the way my body handles dealing with a passing stone. They nickname this stuff the "stonecrusher" and from what I've seen the shoe fits. Imagine going to the restroom to urinate and peeing out what appears to be a powdered version of what you normally contend with. For the first time cloudy urine didn't mean I had a UTI. It meant my body was flushing out pulverized kidney stone! If you deal with kidney stones at all I believe this product may be beneficial for you. And for the price it's way more affordable then multiple costly trips to the urologist only to be told, "It looks like you have a kidney stone." Brilliant!

text: I've been dealing with galbadder issues for at least 10 years now.  It finally got to a point that I knew I would need to do something, which would likely be getting my galbladder removed.  After researching, I discovered many people still complain of pains even after removing their galbladder.  A sarastic "wonderful" came to mind.  After learning about Chanca Piedra, I had to give it a try.I never saw the results that some people saw within a few days or weeks, but I stuck with my daily regimen, which I had decided on: 4 capsules 30 mins after lunch and 4 more 30 mins after dinner (as well cutting out ALL soft drinks, with the occasional one every 6-7 days).  I began on January 24 and at the time of this writing during the first week of March, I have ZERO pains in my stomach near the area of my galbladder.  I do have some slight pain in my right shoulder that began 2-3 weeks prior to this review, but it is starting to subside (which I would guess/attribute to stones moving through duct and some accompanying inflammation) .  More importantly - I am head-over-heels that I feel no stomach pain!!!If you are dealing with galbladder issues, this can't hurt.  Try it for at least 1-3 months if you don't get instant relief.  I will likely start to cut back on my dosage, but I will continue to use this stuff!  I had my doubts, but glad I stuck with it!!!!

productName: CNP Organic Chanca Piedra Concentrate & Extract
title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
text: mightve reacted with thiazide which many kidney stone patients take, webmd says it is a known interaction; could not return. Only  medicine I take. Very terrifying, please do not buy until FDA looks at this stuff. ugh,from google gemini: Yes, it absolutely makes sense that you experienced dizziness and heart racing after taking chanca piedra while also being on hydrochlorothiazide (thiazides). Here's why:Additive blood pressure effects: Both chanca piedra and hydrochlorothiazide can lower blood pressure. Taking them together can lead to a more significant drop than intended, potentially causing dizziness and lightheadedness.Electrolyte imbalance: Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that can cause the body to lose electrolytes, particularly potassium. Chanca piedra might further contribute to this imbalance. Electrolyte imbalances can affect heart rhythm and lead to heart palpitations.It's important to stop taking chanca piedra immediately.  The dizziness and heart racing you experienced are signs that these substances might be interacting negatively in your body.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
text: I've had problems with kidneystones for years, this last year was the worst. My last lithotripsy was a few months ago in September for a 1.3 centimeter stone. My last xray was clear, but the CT scan showed alot of fragments still in that kidney. I decided to try chanca piedra and started taking it. It was a different brand in pill form. I took it daily from that time for 3 months and it didn't help move out any additional stones. I didnt want more buildup back to a large stone again, so I decided to try this brand in liquid form instead. Ive been taking it once a week for about a month. On Thursday I felt a sharp pain in my right side just for a few minutes. I knew a stone was coming down the ureter. I came home and took a dose of this. This morning, I unknowingly passed 2 small stones. The stones were soft and disintegrated when I touched them with a Q-tip. They did not have the hard sharp edges that my prior ones did. I had no pain at all and didn't even know I had passed them! I can't believe it softened them that much! I know i have more, so I just ordered another bottle. I am going to take it daily instead of weekly. This liquid form works so much better than the pill form in other brands. I am going to continue taking this to try to move it all out and as a preventative after that. People need to have patience, sometimes this doesn't work overnight and sometimes it literally does. Some stones are more stubborn with higher or different mineral compositions and crystal concentration. One thing I promise it does, it 100% softens them and makes them much less painful as they pass from the kidneys to the bladder because the sharp edges are gone! I highly recommend giving this a try if you suffer from them like I have!

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2024
text: While sitting on the couch watch TV, March 2, 2024, I felt a terrible pain in my left lower back.  The pain intensified in just a few short minuets.  I was on my knees in pain about to vomit, face sweating, and could not find relieve in any position.  After 4 hours of this, I started looking through the medicine cabinet for anything that would relieve the pain so I could get some sleep.  As I could only find ibuprofen, I took two, which seemed to help, Saturday mooring I felt great!  I was even able to get a P90X work-out in, before going shopping with my wife.  Halfway through shopping, my symptoms returned.  I couldn't wait to get back home and take something for the pain.  I remember feeling every bump in the road as it shot pain up my back.  Again, several ibuprofens and 45 minutes later the pain was gone!  I went to my family doctor on Monday, based on a urine sample, she said it looks like a kidney stone.  As this was my first, I had no idea what I was dealing with.  An X-Ray and Cat-scan that day confirmed a 7,5mm stone was stuck in my ureter.  As this was said to be too large to pass, she advised me to contact the Urology Group in Cincinnati, and she put me on Flowmax.  Researching this on the internet, I started drinking lots of water with lemon juice and apple cider vinger each day.  Although still no pain, on March 13, the Urology Group performed an Extracorporeal shockwave  Lithotripsy to break up the stone.  Although they said the procedure was successful, breaking the stone into two pieces, a day later only some gravel and a bee-bee size piece were expelled.  Although still no pain, two weeks later a follow-up X-ray revealed the stone was still 6,5mm and still stuck in my ureter.  Therefore, aside from pain of the procedure and a cost of $10,000, the Lithotripsy did very little, and the Urology Group then prescribed a more invasive procedure of using a laser to go inside and break it up.  Not looking forward to another procedure and encouraged by the many successful reviews, I ordered this product.  In addition to the Flowmax and drinking 2.5 liters of water per day with concentrated lemon juice, I have been taking it as prescribed for two weeks now, with no results whatsoever!  I was discouraged to hear that this company recently changed their ingredients and the reviews since then have been far less successful.  Unless the pain returns, I believe I will try to wait this out to see if it will eventually pass.  I will repost as this progresses, and hopefully share with all a success story, but for now, this product doesn't seem to help at all!  For the past week, I doubled down on the dosage, two in the morning two in the evening, still no results!

I have had NO other attacks or even "ripples" of anything since. A month age I needed a "cat scan" for another issue and guess what? The kidney stone was alive and well and living in the bladder wall. It was NOT reduced in size at all. It had not been passed or broken down. I had surgery today, Aug. 16, 2023 toremove it. I do not have any idea of how this product works for others, I am only reporting on my own experience with it. I did wholeheartedly believe in it.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
text: Just a few sentences of medical history:I was diagnosed with gallstones in 2019. Since then, my attacks have gotten worse and worse. They used to last 15 to 30 minutes, and now they prolong for hours. So bad - I can expect to be out of commission for at least two days. But the thing of it is I don't want surgery and was trying to find any natural way to help dissolve my gallstones. By researching, I happen to come across Stonebreaker by Chanca Piedra. I read all the positive comments on this thread and decided why not. I gave it a go.I've taken these pills for the last 3 days. Morning and night with water and with my meal. No symptoms. I was thankful for that cause I was scared lol. On the fourth day, I had a late lunch - my first meal of the day. I ate lunch and took my pill. (I had a salad). About two hours later, I’m not even sure what the heck went wrong but my back and right side were KILLING me. I almost mistook it for a gallbladder attack, but eventually noticed the pain was something else - Not my usual gallbladder area under my breast, but my right kidney area (wrapping around my back and side). The pain was so heavy, it stopped me in my tracks and my husband helped me to the bed.My husband helped me by applying a heating pad to my kidney area. Within an hour the intense pain subsided. But the dull ache was still there. That was Saturday. I'm typing this Tuesday night and I can't bend over, twist and turn certain ways without that same dull intense pull/ache. And this happened on the 4th day of taking these pills. Sitting for long periods of time HURTS. Anything that applies pressure to my right kidney side HURTS. The only way I don't feel uncomfortable is if I stand.  I have never ever had a problem with my kidneys. Never. But now it seems I do. I'm praying the pain will just go away, but I will be visiting a Doctor Thursday if it doesn't.I honestly thought I was going to feel something in my gallbladder since there are stones there and not in my kidney, but that was NOT the case. At least for me, it wasn't. I discontinued use of these pills and will be doing more heavy research on them. I encourage you to do the same. I see that this is a good product for some people, and I'm glad they were able to help the majority. I’m not sure what went wrong with me. Maybe not enough water? Not enough rest? I am a very healthy girl except for my stones. I exercise and love eating healthy (especially since 2019). So, I don't know. I just felt like I should share my story because I know what it's like to have gallstones and have no hope of curing them with doctors always ready to cut on you. You are desperate for a solution and ready to try anything – I know I was. I will try to update my condition soon. But in the meantime, if you consider this product, just make sure you do HEAVY research on it. I found out some things if I had known sooner, I might not have purchased.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
text: I was diagnosed with gallstones may of 2019, I weighed 288. Through a vigorous low fat diet I lost over 100lbs and didn't have any flare up since May of 2019. After a week's use of this product I ended up in the ER with and inflamed gallbladder and pancreatitis. Ultimately was forced to go through surgery to get my gallbladder removed. Gallstones ARE NOT PASSABLE. They shouldn't be treated like kidney stones because THEY ARE NOT THE SAME. Attempting to pass a gallstone leads to serious complications. If you are experiencing pain DONT WAIT take it from me. Did not ease any pain, caused immense abdominal pain.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2021
text: This product didn't work for a UVJ stone confirmed by CT at 6mm.  After reading all reviews, I was hoping this work work for me, but pain is still there that comes and goes randomly and when in pain taking it provides no relief.  After consulting with multiple health care providers, I deduced, for a stone in that's in urinary tract (Ureter, Bladder, Urethra) this products effectiveness is likely significantly reduced because anything consumed first enters the blood stream before filtered into the urine.  The chemical compounds in these pills, if they are needed by another organ, then it won't make it into the urine to help break up the stones.  I had takes two pills, three times per day, until finished the whole bottle, which is higher than normal dosage and that also had no effect.After reading all the reviews, I had hoped this would help me, but it didn't.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
text: I am writing this review totally unbiased.  To start, I got word of this product from a youtube video, someone said that it worked very well also the reviews were outstanding.  However,my experience was very different. About 2 months ago I had my first gallbladder attack ,extremely painful and scary. I eat a very healthy whole foods diet prior, so taking this I figured would only aid in getting rid of any further attack or previous stones from not eating the best when I was younger. I bought my first bottle. Followed the instructions and for about 2 weeks, there was no pain, no sign of gallbladder attacks, I was convinced that this was the reason. I was so excited that I bought another bottle to have on hand before my first ran out. After 2 weeks of taking it,I was doubled over in severe pain. Worst pain of my life and nothing would take it away. After 2 days of chronic pain I was rushed to the ER where they told me I had a lodged stone, and pancreatitis due to the lodged stone. Worst pain you will ever feel! Also i was told that i would need my gallbladder removed immediately.  When removing my gallbladder a duct was clogged with what was described as sludge and mini stones. Now this could be a coincidence or this product was breaking up stuff and got it stuck in my duct causing all these issues. It is no joke when I say, take these with a risk. If stones are breaking rapidly they can cause a clog. I am all about natural products, but I fear this could do more harm than good. 2 bottles, waste of money. Would not recommend.  I need to get a refund. Good luck all.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
text: I took my first pill last night and I really wish I hadn't - I had a terrible reaction.  Be sure to look up the potential side effects of the two main ingredients.  I was dizzy (a possible side effect of hydrangea) and was stumbling around trying to get ready for bed.  I was also light-headed and nauseous (light-headed could have been low blood sugar, a possible side effect of chanca piedra, nausea is a possible side effect of hydrangea.).  I should note that I took the pill with a meal as directed.  I am typically healthy, except for gall stones, and I've been doing a keto diet for 14 weeks and exercising 5 days a week.  My guess is that this product caused a blood sugar drop a couple of hours after taking it and that I had a reaction to the hydrangea.  I know better than to take herbal remedies without better research than seeing a bunch of positive reviews.  I do believe that this does work for some, just not for me.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
text: I can't speak to how this product works for kidney stones, but it did nothing for my gallstones and I took it for many months twice daily, sometimes two pills in the morning with lots of water. I recently had my gallbladder surgically removed because the stones were not "broken" but my gallblader had become inflamed and was a danger to my other organs.This isn't a cheap product, so think twice if you think you can break any gallbladder stones using this product regularly for an extended period of time. I cancelled my subscription and will apply that money towards supplements that help with my situation. I didn't give it one star, because like I said, maybe it works wonders for kidneys. But they should be honest about it truly working for both because kidney stones and gallbladder stones are different balls of wax, so I should have been more dubious of their claims. I guess I was hoping to avoid surgery in the future, but here I am recovering from surgery. If your abdominal pain increases like mine did, get a doctor to do an ultrasound and/or CAT scan to see if your gallbladder has gotten worse like mine did. Because left untreated it can harm other organs and cause more serious issues, like pancreatitis etc.

text: I bought these after noticing that I was having back pain and lower abdominal cramps.  Since I had a kidney stone 11 years ago and also knew that I had 2 stones that were seen during an ultrasound a few years ago, I knew I had another kidney stone issue.  I had hoped that these would work and wanted to avoid the Emergency Room at all cost (there is no other way to get medical treatment for a stone...you must go to an ER, at least here in the midwest).I took them as prescribed, then was told by a family member that I might want to double the dose, so I did that.  I also did "shots" of lemon juice and olive oil, which really helped the pain.  But I ended up in the ER a few weeks later and am scheduled for surgery to remove 2 very large stones from the right kidney.  There is a smaller one on the left, but I will leave that one alone for now.  Anyway, my stones didn't change in size (I had an ultrasound before taking them, then another in the ER) and I don't think the Stone Breaker had much effect at all, darn it.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
text: ** This review is based on my husband's experience with a kidney stone that nearly put him in the hospital. If you are dealing with one that makes you think you're being murdered from the inside out, this review may help you decide on whether or not to give this product a try. I will be updating this review as time passes. I will try to be as detailed as I can be, and try to keep it short, sweet, and to the point.**Quick Facts & Helpful Tips:- My husband is 32 (first stone was at 22)- Unsure of what "type" of kidney stones he deals with- Has had 1 emergency surgical removal of a stone in the past- Has a VERY high pain tolerance- We do not have insurance & all medication is over-the-counterPrior to taking "Stone Breaker":- Was taking generic-brand regular acetaminophen for pain (did not help at all)- The pain was intense enough to bring him to tears and cause vomiting- Was unable to sleep for more than an hour or so at a time- Was unable to eat for days- Experienced irritability and increased stress levels- Had symptoms of this kidney stone for 7 days before "Stone Breaker"- Drank a gallon of water and 1 cup of lemon juice every dayAfter starting "Stone Breaker":- Capsules have no flavor and do not leave an after-taste- Taking product with or without a meal made no difference for him- Started taking 2 generic-brand acetaminophen arthritis pain-killers as needed (works very well)- Drinks a gallon of water and 1 cup of lemon juice daily- 2 days after starting product, went down to 1 pain-killer as needed- Has to pee a whole lot more than before starting this product- Uses a heating pad for pain, and it helps a lot- Is able to eat and sleep more regularlyIt's only been 2 days since he started the product and 9 days since the symptoms began. He has not passed the stone yet. However, he is able to get through the day without puking or ending up on the ground in tears since he began taking the product. Keep in mind that the amount of help that this product has given him is unknown because he had started the process of water and lemon juice 5 days prior to the product. Those two things are what they recommend to help with passing a stone, but there is a clear difference since starting the product. Again, I will update in a week, or if he passes the stone before that time.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
text: I had a kidney stone for a total of 23 days. On the first day I was put on flowmax and stayed on that for the first 13 days. However, after a week I also started taking a liquid Stone Breaker drop until day 12. The liquid form should have lasted several days at least, but I finished two bottles within 5 days. I ordered this Stone Breaker tablet as the taste of the liquid was not great. It arrived on day 14. I took 2 capsules twice daily for a total of 7.5 days, then forgot the bottle at work, so I didn’t take the evening dose. The 3mm Stone ended up passing the following morning. I also drank probably 150oz of water daily from the beginning and mixed in lemon juice here and there. Per the CT Scans the Stone was stuck in the very bottom of the ureter the entire time, so luckily it didn’t hurt often. Maybe this helped keep inflammation down? Maybe not? I’m really not so sure the Stone didn’t just pass itself.

text: I had great hopes for this product after reading the reviews. After an adbominal scan last December because of constant stomach pain, we found out I had numerous gallstones, average size 6.5 mm. I changed my diet (I thought I was eating healthy!), drank tons of apple cider vinegar, and the pain went away. I started taking fiber, milk thistle and probiotics to help my liver and gallblader speed things up. I thought I was doing great avoiding surgery, but the pain came back a few weeks ago. That's when I ordered this product with extra fast shipping to boot!It seemed to help with the pain at first, but as soon as I eat a piece of cheese, more than two bites of meat or have a glass of wine, the pain comes back. Forget about dessert. I took the maximum dose per day (4 capsules) for 10 days, now I take two, but it doesn't matter. Anything else than starchy foods and fruits and veggies cause pain.I have ordered ox bile and will try Stone Free, as I'm a bit desperate and really want to avoid surgery (heard of too many people having other problems after that).

text: I think this product was working as I saw small stones. At first, the product was fine. By the 3rd week, all of a sudden I started having sudden hot flashes a few times a day that would last 3-5 min. By the end before I quit taking them, the hot flashes were coming on many times during the day. I checked the ingredients to see what the cause might be. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
text: I was in the ER back in november 2021 and was told I have a 6mm kidney stone in my left kidney. 3 months later, I started experiencing a lot of discomfort, burning when urinating, and a constant pressure feeling like I need to urinate. Many tests later, the scan came back showing that my stone is still in my track and it will need to be removed with surgery. I found Stone Breaker and ordered it immediately. The package came a day late so I am trying to play catch up in taking the pills in hopes of passing the stone before my scheduled surgery 1/17/22. I have taken 6 pills total over the last 2 days and have not passed any stone yet but I will say this is the first time in weeks I haven't had to take any pain medication. These herbs have definitely taken away my pain and have helped tremendously in helping me urinate. For weeks I've been sitting in warm baths for hours but since taking the herbs I haven't taken a single bath and have slept through the night. I was told that one week before surgery I would need to stop taking any vitamins or herbal supplements before surgery which would mean I have to stop today. I am so determined to pass this without surgery I am going to take these for 1 more day in hopes I get lucky and can cancel surgery. I read a review here online of an x-ray technician stating if the stone is obstructing your tract then these will not help. Unfortunately mine is obstructing my tract so If i don't pass it before my surgery, I'll know why. Either way I plan to continue taking this medicine after surgery as a preventative. Rated 4 stars only because I haven't passed it yet but I believe if I had more time before surgery, I might have been able to pass the stone with these.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2021
text: I was diagnosed with two kidney stones after a bevy of uncomfortable symptoms in February 2021. Following CT scan, found a 1.5mm and 2.5mm. I initially took 2 capsules per day as directed, but after one month, tapered down to 1 capsule a day as I wasn't having UTI-like symptoms anymore and it was more in hopes of preventing more stones/existing stones from growing. The symptoms I did have (frequent nocturia, UTI-like symptoms of burning and pain) resolved after less than a week of taking two capsules per day.September 2021, had another CT scan to find the 1.5mm stone vanished (I wasn't aware of passing anything, and I understand it can be excruciating) and the 2.5mm stone is now 3mm but the Hounsfield density decreased from 400-something to 300-something.Other habits I picked up included:1. Drinking the juice of two fresh lemons every day2. Avoiding all high oxalate foods (former keto dieter, unfortunately)3. Ensuring I get enough dairy when I do eat moderately-high oxalate foods4. Drinking 5+ liters of water a day depending on my activity level.I'm certainly not going to stop taking this supplement if there's even a 1% percent chance it helped get rid of the other stone and saved me the suffering of passing it. Here's to hoping the remaining stone will stop growing! All in all, highly recommend.

First a whole day of nauseas and dry heaving and painful constipation from the anesthesia, the latter lasting 2 1/2 days. Also  pain, fever, bleeding and burning when urinating, weakness, loss of appetite, hypersensitivity to smells, and various body pains in upper and lower back which interfered with sleep. It's been a nightmare. And I still have to go for stent removal in a month. It's all too much, too violent and traumatic on the body. Please try this first.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
text: I had struggled with a pain in my side for several months.  Th family doctor said it was 'muscular-skeletal' but I talked him into giving me an MRI.  This showed the Kidney stones - two of them, slightly smaller than a pair of dice.He did not have any easy solutions for me - surgery would be very expensive.  So I went to a naturalist who recommended Magnesium tablets, which I took for about two weeks.  I did not sense any results, so I started hunting for something else on the web, and found these on Amazon.  Along with the Magnesium tablets, I started taking these tablets (or maybe they were capsules - I do not remember) twice a day.  This worked.  After about a week of taking these twice a day with about 8 oz of water, the stone passed, relatively painlessly.  The only problem was the the pills seemed to cause bouts with sudden, unexpected, and almost uncontrollable diarrhea. This started the third day, I think.This was still vastly preferable to other ways of dealing with the stones, and the pills may not have this effect on you.  I have no way of knowing.  But you might want to be cautious with your plans the first couple of days that you take these pills.

The doctor came back in the room and said he was going to prep me for surgery again I was pumped up with morphine no pain thought I would just go home and investigate further as far as homeopathic cures then I stumbled across this chanca Piedra which as I understand translates to stonebraker figured for $30 what did I have to lose. So I took two a day for about 4 weeks had no flare-ups stop taking them for a while had a flare up Fourth of July 2018 at a barbecue on my way home became nauseous threw up when I got to my driveway got in the house took two capsules lay down and literally within 15 minutes felt completely fine I have  had a few other flare-ups in the meantime and I always carry a few of these with me every single time I have had one I popped two of these and pain is gone don't know why the doctors don't recommend this before surgery but I feel like it's a miracle cure.Update: Okay so I had another gallstone attack yesterday (9-27-18) at 4 am I woke up with a slight pain and got up immediately and took two caps. NOTHING! Pain increased to the point after 4 hours I was taken to the emergency room again to get Morphine. I probably shouldn't have eaten the three greasy tacos late the night before. I ended up having to have my gallbladder removed but I am pretty sure it was Stonebreaker that kept me from the excruciating pain I should have, by all rights, been in. I gave it 4 stars only because this is obviously anecdotal and it may not have been the reason for my lack of pain. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
text: This is the first review I have ever made on any product. I hope my review will bring you hope if you are struggling with kidney stones.It started in the summer of 2022 when I was 4 months pregnant. At the time, it was UTI like symptoms. Due to my pregnancy, I was unable to take any type of herbal supplements I was just given pain medication. I dealt with the intolerable pain for two months and when I was 6 months pregnant I had emergency removal of 2 stones one on each side- 0.5mm and 0.8mm following stent placement for a week and stent removal and yes- that felt like I was giving birth. MRI performed before the removal of the stones showed I had 2 smaller stones on each kidney which were not removed during the procedure.Fast forward a year later- July 2023 I started with UTI like symptoms once again. I knew right away they were the kidney stones. I went to my urologist to test for a UTI and she confirmed there was indeed blood in urine confirming stones. I decided to try this product as it was my only and last hope as I was preparing myself for yet another removal procedure and financial strain on my savings. Ordered on Sunday night, product arrived on Tuesday and took as followed:1. Tuesday night- I had excruciating pain (pain level 9). It got worse when I took a glass with lime. Flank pain started and I took two supplements. Thirty minutes later I had very little to no urine and my bladder was hurting. I was debating whether to go to the ER. About 45 min into the pain I felt sharp pinching as the stone was moving down my urethra. Immediately after the sharp pinching feeling I was able to urinate.  Pain diminished slowly and was able to rest for the night.2. Wednesday morning- While fasting as soon as I woke up I took another glass with lime and added apple cider vinegar. I took one supplement with it. I was feeling ok throughout the morning with mild UTI like burning symptoms. By the afternoon after having some lunch, I had another glass with lime and apple cider vinegar. My pain increased to sharp pinching feeling in my urethra and pressure. I knew the stone was there and was a matter of time before I urinated it out. About an hour into my pain when laying down the sharp feeling intensified and all of a sudden it was gone- instant relief?! I ran to the restroom I heard a clank on the toilet bowl and there it was the stone!I will continue to take this to hopefully dissolve the others out. I highly recommend this product along with taking it with lime water and apple cider vinegar. I hope to never look back on kidney stone surgery removal and I hope you never have to go through that. God bless.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
text: the 19th of October I went to the ER with intolerable pains, I was given morphine and another narcotic pill for pain, ct scans revealed I had two 5mm stones, I was released at about 2 am with a prescription for pain meds, "flow" meds, and nausea meds, I had an old bottle of chanca piedra because about 3 years ago, an unrelated scan found a tiny stone, so I bought some, I never felt that stone and it came out un noticed, I had some left over and started taking it the next day, it was expired, but I used it anyway,  I bought a fresh bottle, it arrived the Sunday after my ER visit, I took pain meds as needed for about 3 days, then stopped all meds when the pains started getting lesser and lesser, (the flowmax made my nose stuffy and I couldn't breathe, so I stopped that pretty much right away, I took only two pills for nausea because I did puke the next day) 2 weeks taking chanca piedra , 2 capsules, twice a day, (with lots and lots of water and a cup of Palo Azul tea) I feel zero pain now, Im not even sure if I let them out yet, ER dr told me 5mm stones are right at the border between small and large, so I was afraid the pain was only going to get worse once it was time for them to come out, not to mention all the stories people were telling me, comparing the pain to that of child birth, even my doctor told me she felt sorry for me...I told her I was taking these and she said as long as I don't feel worse, she's ok with it,  two weeks after discovering I had two 5mm stones and Im convinced these capsules are the real deal, I doubt these stones just go away on their own, so yea, this stuff worked for me, (I read a few reviews talking about diarrhea, I didn't have that issue so Im guessing it may just be a rare side effect?)  5 stars from me

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2022
text: I get that correlation does not equal causation, and I am typically rather skeptical but. . .I had an 8mm stone that caused me serious pain and had made its way to my lower left ureter and was stuck by the time I went to the ER.  The doc told me that if it had made it that far it "might" pass or I could be admitted and get a stent.  I took my chances with a diruetic, pain meds, and an antibiotic.  After about a day, it passed to my bladder but was then stuck again.  I took two of these every 4-6 hours and (painfully) passed the stone within about 36 hours. Radiography showed another 7mm stone in my left kidney and a 9mm stone and 3mm stone in my right.  So I continued taking the supplements once daily as a preventative and did well for four months; however, I had a three week lapse when we had some summer schedule changes.  Alas, pain on the right side.  I started them again and my pain went away within two days.  Could it be my increase in water intake?  Sure.  Could it be a coincidence?  Yeah.  Could it be a placebo effect?  I suppose. Am I ordering a second bottle and setting a daily reminder to tell me to take it?  Yup.

I had him finish the supplement and then boom, the pain began again. Ordered another bottle, saw the doctor and got another CTScan which said the 3mm stone was descending down the ureter. Got the bottle of supplement Thursday and started him on them immediately. Saturday afternoon he comes out of the bathroom (didn’t screen) and says “I think I just passed 2 stones”  I didn’t get to see them but I did see the next sample with blood clots so I figured he did and all his pain was gone. We are now a month without any pain and NO surgery. He and I are believers.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
text: I’m 35 and have passed at least 20 kidney stones. I’ve been in the emergency room four times, and a week ago my kidney decided to let loose the largest kidney stone I’ve ever had. The CT scan measured it at 5.2 mm, and my doctor said if I didn’t pass it in a week I needed to schedule lithotripsy. He didn’t think I could do it myself. I have been doing everything. I’ve been taking herbs, drinking water and coconut water, taking homeopathy, etc. I’ve taken Chanca Piedra in various forms for years, including capsules and tinctures. In a moment of desperation, I ordered this tea. It arrived yesterday afternoon, and I had one mug full of it. Immediately, I noticed a very relaxing feeling come over me and the pain decreased a little bit. I felt more myself last night than I have in the past week, and I finally felt hope that I would be ok. About 24 hours later, I painlessly peed this stone out. You can’t tell from the pictures, but it is smaller than the 5.2 mm the hospital said it was. It’s also smooth (I’ve passed several that had huge teeth). I doubt this tea is solely responsible for me passing the stone, but I know it played a huge part. I will be drinking this regularly for the rest of my life.

text: I don't know why but it works. I was having a big gallbladder pains. I've been having gallbladder problems for 5 years and they never remove it in the ER. So i was having a flare. I can always tell when it's enlarged and full of stones and slugde. I bought this because I read good reviews. Thinking it wasn't gonna work and i was gonna end up in the ER again. so as soon as I receive it, it soon began. I can feel it getting angry and angrier. I was in so much pain. By this time I wasn't eating anything. So middle of the day came and i had another 2 tea bags, oh boy it got angrier. Then night came and i had 2 more tea bags (always drink it really hot and no sugar or anything else on it). By the night i was in agony. I was crying and in labour with stones. One after another after another. So the next morning i had 1 tea bag. It kept going. I can still feel it's large and angry. I kept drinking 1 tea bag 3 times a day despite being in agonizing pain. I was crying and just wanted to stop. But I pushed through. Finally the pain of stone passing stopped. But it wasn't over, i still have a large gallbladder filled with sludge. Now that had to come out. We are 3 days in and i kept drinking the tea (3 times a day). But the sludge was only coming out slowly. Finally 7 days later my gallbladder is empty and back to normal. Avoided a trip to the ER and surgery. Thanks.Edit: what I went through is not for everybody. It was a battle at home. I did everything while on a liquid diet no sugars or solids as well as nothing greasy. It has been years and still no pain and no stones and I eat healthy but back to normal. Thanks.

text: THIS WORKS!! I was diagnosed with 4-5 mm kidney stone stuck in my ureter. This is my first time ever  having a kidney stone. My doctor told me it was likely not going to pass because of the size & location but prescribed some medicine & said we could wait it out for a couple of weeks. I prefer natural remedies so decided not to take the prescription. A few days later I had a kidney stone attack & was in so much pain, inflamed, flank pain, running to the toilet literally every 10 min for nothing but dribbles, slight nausea, & I could barely walk so stayed in bed all day. Long story short I made an anti-inflammatory juice shot (ginger root, apple, orange, lemon, tumeric powder, & black pepper). About 30 min later I started feeling better!! The pain, inflammation, & nausea subsided! I wad able to move around & cook dinner. I decided to try the chanca piedra to help in passing the stone. After 3 days of the juice shot 2x/day & the chanca piedra 3x/day my urinary retention cleared! I was no longer dribbling. I was determined to pass the stone naturally so I pushed my follow up appt out to 2 months & for those 2 months this was my daily remedy : 1.) drank 12-16 cups of water daily starting the morning off with 2 cups of warm lemon or lime water, 2.) chanca piedra 3x/ day, & 3.) a cup of ACV water (2 Tbsp unfiltered organic  apple cider vinegar) 5x/day (*1 week on & 1 week off*). I also prayed to God that my stone would not only pass naturally but that it would dissolve so I wouldn’t feel it…and 2 months later I am excited to say my scan results came back clear!! The doctor was SO suprised that it passed! And I never felt any pain when it passed nor did I ever see it (and I checked every time).  All glory to God!!

text: After being knocked down for 8 hours in excruciating pain, CT Scan showed I had 6mm kidney stone in my ureter. The doctor handed me pain meds and said "good luck". So I purchased this product as part of a desperate attempt to save myself from additional pain.  My overall menu changes included the following plan:- eliminated sodium and oxalates including spinach and nuts which I ate a ton of- lowered calcium, alcohol, and coffee intake as much as humanly possible- stopped taking my normal daily vitamin- added Neeri tablets also purchased on Amazon (3 tablets x3 per day)- drank a ton of lemon juice, lemons in all my water, and eating a ton of watermelon- mixed in apple cider vinegar when I hit my lemon juice max- a kidney cleanse daily tablet (2 tablets x1 per day) used the Health Plus version- doctor prescribed Tamsulosin = Flomax (1 tablet x1 per day)- then this product Chanca Piedra stone breaker (1 stopper full x3 per day)As you can see a lot going on but after 30 days of no pain X-ray showed the stone was still there but re-estimated at 4mm.  Then on day 50 another follow up X-ray showed no stone. The same doctor that said "good luck" now all he could say was "congratulations". The stone had passed with no additional pain and celebration ensued. Hopefully someone else will benefit from my experience because I do not wish kidney stone pain on my worst enemy!

My Doctor had me scheduled for outpatient sonic wave procedure to break up my stones so they could pass on their own. I took Chanca tablets 3 times per day for the two weeks prior to the outpatient procedure, and I was sure based on the reviews that they would work. They didn't. They had zero affect on my stones. While in for the sonic procedure, I looked at the live X-ray before going under and saw two, whole, hard as rock stones in my kidney. Chanca did nothing. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021
text: January 22, 2021: Did not dissolve gallstones but does help with biliary cholic pain in the middle of the night. Stone Free works a bit better for pain but it has licorice root in it and it gave me chest pain separate from the gallbladder pain sometimes. Licorice root can cause kidney or heart failure so watch for signs of pain, in anything you try really. I did not want to be on Lidan Paishi Pian or Jin qian cao for longer than a bottle, as those have arsenic and lead in them but they're also known to help dissolve stones. Those pills did nothing for mine there either, a lot of good painkillers though.I heard Rowachol and TUDCA work better for gallstones specifically. Google dosages and you'll find them. I'm 104kg and at 10mg/kg that would be 1,040 mg in a day for TUDCA. Split 3 ways  is 346mg per meal. 500mg was too much for me and I got pain. Start small on the 250mg bottle for TUDCA. Good luck to whoever is reading this.**UPDATE April 7, 2023: Definitely do Rowachol and TUDCA. I no longer have a stone stuck in the neck of my gallbladder! I ate a flexitarian diet and used Dandy Blend coffee powder to replace coffee for a while. Switched to almond milk. If you have serious inflammation after a gallbladder attack I highly suggest laying off the meat for at least a month or 2. Just my experience, I'm not a doctor.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2018
text: I am a person who can stand pain easily and I try to avoid analgesics, but 20 days ago I went to the emergency room for this really bad back pain. They made a CT without contrast and they found a 3 mm “something” in the left Ureter, very close to the bladder. Since they ordered the CT without contrast in the emergency room, my urologist is not certain that what I have is a stone or (something else I don’t remember the name).  I Have been taking Flomax along with a higher dose prescribed alieve (pain reliever) for the last 19 days, and also Chancapiedra for the las 18 days. At this point I already scheduled the CT with contrast, because I still have pain and no stone has come out. Maybe I have a type of stone that needs to be treated with another herb, or maybe is not a stone. Time will tell. However, I brother had kidney stones in the past and he treated it with chancapiedra and it worked for him.  Today I started to take a combination of ginger, turmeric and holy basil herbs to substitute the intake of alieve (I don’t want to destroy my stomach with high dosage analgesics) and it is helping with the pain. I am still taking the chancapiedra to see if something comes out before the day of my next CT. I hope this review help others.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2021
text: I've suffered from kidney stones for about 15 years. In the beginning, i would get 1 every other year but the past 4 years, i get them like evey few months.  Ive been to a urologist, been on potassium citrate, lowered my sodium, cut back on high oxalate foods, taken 24 hr urine tests.. And before taking this pill, the only thing that kinda helped was taking a good probiotic (there is research that shows that certain strains of probiotics will bind with oxalates and prevent them from binding with calcium to form a stone).  I came across a different brand of chanca peidra back in october and took it for about a month (4 pills daily) but nothing passed (it is now april). Last year at a urologist check up and an ultrasound, i had a 6 mm stone in my right kidney and a 5mm stone on left side.  So that's what led me to try chanca piedra last oct.  Fast forward to first week of april, i started to feel mild back pain and i knew it was the stone moving (but this has been ongoing since feb 2020). So i decided to try this brand of chanca piedra. I received it on apr 14... Took 2 a day for about 5 days.. Then i stopped.. No reason why just forgot to keep taking it. And today is apr 24 and i passed the dark stone (see pic).. Now the only way for me to know for sure if it is the 5mm or 6mm stone is to have an ultrasound or ct or mri.. But I'm willing to bet that it is indeed the 6mm that was in my right side.  For me, i believe these pills helped as i have been trying everything the urologist prescribed for over a year now with no results until this.  I know that stones over 7mm require surgical intervention so I'm glad i didnt have to have it surgically removed (and I've had to have surgery for stone removal as well).

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
text: Though I’m not aware of any scientific evidence these are good for gallstones (studies on kidney stones are promising) they do seem to help, certainly more than those Christopher Quack snakeoil pills for liver & gall. Plus, these don’t require you to take 6 freaking pills a day to see any benefit like Christopher’s. I have gall sludge & small gallstones that cause severe discomfort. I have been taking one of these a day for the past month and they do seem to be helping reduce synptoms. Will increase to 2 since I am tolerating them well.I don’t see myself doing sets of situps yet but these are helping until I can get gallbladder surgery.  I am able to move around more with less discomfort. Gallbladder disease is no joke, it causes severe discomfort & any relief is worth it. Though I doubt these are going to make my gall issues disappear...only surgery is going to fix that, not magic beans & olive oil flushes.

I still do take this supplement (periodically), and I do the gallbladder flush from time to time ( like once or twice a year). Reviews looked good, so against that type of pain, anything 4.5 stars and $20 is worth a shot. Started by taking the 2 & 2 and there was noticable relief within 24 hours. Continued that dosage for about 7-10 days while the symptoms kept regressing towards normal. Went down to 1 a day after a couple weeks and no symptoms for a few days....It's now been 4 months since that ordeal. Never get get any more symptoms or pass a stone. I'm keeping up with the one per (most) days maintenance dosage, and will never be without this product in my house again. Buy it.

text: I had to write this review to help others who suffer from kidney stones.  I’ve had two surgeries in the past on stones and did not want to go through that again.  My first symptom was the flank pain in my back and I knew it was happening again. Ugh.  I waited quite awhile for it to come down in my ureter and then the pain started. Renal colic is the worst!  I landed in the emergency room and was happy to hear it was a 3.5mm stone with two smaller stones still in my left kidney.  I read the reviews on Amazon and have heard of this natural method actually helping people.  So I took the Chanca Pietdra according to bottle instructions and within 7 days, I passed my stone without any drama what’s so ever!  At first, I was feeling tiny particles when i urinated and I didn’t think anything of it.  What actually happens is the Chanca Piedra breaks it down into small sandy particles making it smaller to pass.  I figured that out when i started to strain my urine and one morning PLOP! Out it came!!!  I did it without surgery!!!  Also, a few tablespoons of vinegar water ,and honey helped along with drinking fresh lemon water sped it along.  I still had to take something for the pain when it was in the ureter, but this product helped to make having a kidney stone manageable.  I believe i get kidney stones from taking antihistamines for my allergies s and NOT drinking enough water.  I ordered the Chanca Piedra tea to drink once a day to ward off the evil stones.  Plus, I’m mindful of drinking my tons of water a day with a little fresh lemon juice.  It may take a little time, or not!!!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2022
text: Thank you Chanca Piedra!  This product absolutely worked for me.  A 65 year old male diagnosed with a 6 mm kidney stone entering ureter on left side by CT scan.  First time in my life that I experienced this type of pain.  Couldn’t sit, stand, lay down, nothing would ease the pain.  I was prescribed pain meds by the urologist and told I hade a 50/50 chance of passing the stone.  He told me to make a follow up appointment in 30 days to reassess the situation.My daughter did some on-line research for me and found this product.  We were impressed with the many positive reviews and ratings.  Faced with the proposition of being in pain for at least 30 more days and having to possibly go through other medical procedures to blast it or extract it, I figured what did I have to lose by trying Chanca Piedra.  I took two pills twice a day for eight days before passing the stone with no issue.  The pain meds helped me manage the pain while giving Chanca Piedra time to work.  I also took flowmax as directed by doctor, and 2 capsules of apple cider vinegar daily (I decided to add this on my own) and I drank lots of water.  All of this, coupled with God’s answer to my prayers, got me out of pain, out of this situation, and back to normal.A couple sandlike particles appeared in the toilet bowl 2 or 3 urinations prior to passing the big one - a 6mm diameter soft dark brown  deflated pea-shaped membrane that shot out while peeing with no pain or issue.  I am now pain and stone free.  I am such a believer in this product that I’m leaving this review for the next person in similar circumstance and telling anyone and everyone I know about this product

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
text: My husband has intermittent bouts of Gout, depending on his diet, the weather, and how much water he does or does not drink.  When he has experienced an episode of it, he hurts.  It stinks to see someone I love hurt.I bought this supplement on a whim to see if it helped, and it has.  He states that he definitely feels better when he is taking this.  He can take this routinely, or he can take a medicine prescribed by his health care physician.  He says that this supplement reduces episodes, and that he feels better when he takes it.As to the science, it holds up.  While not approved by the FDA, clinical studies have found that chanca piedra reduces urinary oxalate and uric acid -- this stuff reduces the ability of your pee to create kidney stones.  A 2014 study found that chanca piedra has the ability to inhibit the growth of H. pylori, which, as an organism, is a jerk:  it's connected to cancer and stomach ulcers.  It has been found to help people with hep B by stopping its growth.  The reason that chanca piedra helps fight gout is that gout episodes occur when high levels of uric acid present in the body.  Less uric acid, less gout.My husband took this for a month to see a difference.  Now he asks me to re-order it when he is running low.  I take this as a real sign of its efficacy, because, well, he's a man.  Ha ha.I recommend that anyone with gout symptoms give it a try after reading up on its contraindications and talking to his or her doctor.  We did, and it is now a constant in his medicine cabinet.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
text: In South America, there is an herb for each specific malady known to humankind. This is why we must do what we can to assist in the preservation of the environment and culture, before these plants and tribal heritage of medicine is lost entirely.That said, Chanca Piedra is the herb for kidney stones. I am so happy someone is making this available to everyone and doing it in a responsible way.I read the reviews before buying to be sure I felt confident the herb may work for me.Expect with All natural remedies that they must be followed by strict repetitive regimen long term in order to see results.Disclaimer: I don't think that a particular remedy, even if it has been proven effective, will necessarily work for a particular malady, just because there are certain causes and conditions at work in each individual instance.If you are facing grave pain, like a kidney stone, I say it's worth it to check it out. Always following Dr. advice along with your own thoughts.The capsules are clear, showing powdered dark green contents. And there is no smell or taste I can perceive.I have a sensitive stomach and feel nothing, even when I take 2 capsules together.I have only just begun with this formula, and plan to update when there are results to add to this review.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2017
text: I ordered it as a supplemental source of potassium. I did not want pills, as they always contain excipient ingredients. Unlike lite salt (which also contains potassium) this is a bulk product that contains no sodium. Great!Also, its citrate has two side side benefits:1) Citrate intake helps to prevent the most common type of kidney stone.2) Citrates inhibit an enzyme that supports one stage of glycolysis, making them useful in reduction of high blood sugar levels.My visual inspection of the powder I received showed no clumping. That testifies to the thorough sealing and air tightness of its packaging, because potassium citrate is very hygroscopic. I looked for obvious contamination, but saw no foreign matter in it. And it dissolved readily in filtered tap water.Potassium citrate formula : C6H5K3O7So there are 3 atoms of K per molecule of potassium citrate.Thus, potassium citrate is comprised of (3×39) / 306 = 38% potassium (K)With my AWS model AC-100 100 gram digital scale I measured a ¼ US cup volume of Bulk Supplements Potassium Citrate granules to be 63 grams. Since ¼ US cup = 12 US tsp, and the USA adult DV of K is 4700 mg, we have for this supplement :½ tsp = 2625 mg C6H5K3O7; 998 mg K; 21% DV1 tsp = 5250 mg C6H5K3O7; 1995 mg K; 42% DV2 tsp = 10,500 mg C6H5K3O7; 3990 mg K; 85% DV3 ¼ tsp = 17,053 mg C6H5K3O7; 6480 mg K; 138% DVSo the 275 mg serving ( which is only 0.05 tsp ) labeled on this powder's Supplement Facts is insignificantly small. That dose provides only 2% USA adult DV, which is incorrectly labeled as a 3% DV for K. The next richest supplementary source of K ( to this citrate powder ) is Morton Lite Salt, but 2 US tsp of it would be required daily in order to get 80% DV of K, and that would mean an intake of 96% of the sodium DV.TIPSIn general, American adults are recommended to get at least 4,700 mg (100% DV) of potassium daily, while limiting daily sodium to 1,500 mg.  But most Americans are not meeting either goal. See the two USDA reports: 'Potassium Intake of the U.S. Population' and 'Sodium Intake of the U.S. Population'. Perhaps the U.S. National Library of Medicine has set the potassium DV absurdly high? The Austrailian Ministry of Health has set their adult men's DV at 81% as high as the USA's, and their adult women's DV is only 60% as high as the USA's.The richest dietary source of potassium (K) is not a banana, but chard. However, it is extremely high in oxalate. A baked potato (with skin), is richer in K than a banana, but one would have to consume five of them per day in order to obtain 100% of the USA adult DV of K !Extended release potassium citrate tablets are prescribed as a long term therapy for treating calcium oxalate kidney stones. The daily intake of those tablets totals 6400 mg as four equally spaced doses. These patients are also advised to restrict their dietary oxalate intake, while increasing their intake of water.CAUTIONThere is a purity issue with this Chinese product. Bulk Supplements did not provide a certificate of analysis with the package. That should be a document prepared by an independent 3rd party. Had they provided an acceptable report I would've given this product a 5-star rating.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2015
text: I take a total of 1/2 tsp (~3000 mg) per day dissolved in water to aid in the prevention of kidney stones. This works out to ~28 mEq/day at a total cost of $0.12/day. Price certainly beats prescription potassium citrate (Urocit-K), which is in on the order of $1.00-1.50 per 10 mEq pill. Have no way to test potency or purity, so hopefully the supplier can be trusted.In patients with severe hypocitraturia (low amount of citrates in the urine, a risk factor for the most common type of kidney stones), the starting dose of Urocit-K is 60 mEq /day (30 mEq two times/day or 20 mEq three times/day). For mild to moderate hypocitraturia the starting dose is 30 mEq/day (15 mEq two times/day or 10 mEq three times/day).

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars

text: I have recently added this to magnesium citrate (same supplier) to help prevent kidney stones (which I have had). After a lot of research on this subject I found the most useful item to be an abstract on a gov. site from an article in the 12/97 issue of the Journal of Urology. In a 3yr. study the group given potassium-magnesium citrate showed that it reduced the risk of calcium oxalate stone formation by 85% compared to the placebo group.The potassium citrate powder from BulkSupplements comes well packaged in a resealable pouch. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2015
text: Quick delivery and well packaged.  I decided to try it since my daily potassium intake rarely ever approaches the daily recommended allowance.  I enjoy sweet potatoes and bananas, but you have to eat a lot to make it anywhere close 2500 mg or more.  I also wanted to try to this product as prophylactic measure against kidney stones and gout.  I have three members in my immediate family who have had gout attacks and I was unfortunate enough to have one attack over a year ago after three straight weekends of barbecue, beer, and shellfish.  The attack only lasted a week and I haven't had one since, but I do not ever want to experience one again.  Now this is internet science, so take it for what it's worth, but I've read that potassium citrate helps dissolve both uric acid and calcium oxalate so that it is excreted through the urine as opposed to ending up in your bloodstream and settling in your joints and/or forming accretions in your bladder/ureter/kidneys.  I haven't conferred with any physicians to get their two cents on the issue, but I'm hoping that by adding a small amount of this product to my diet, I won't need to see any doctors to treat or diagnose either ailment in the first place.  Speaking of dosages, the package contains a very large amount of concentrated potassium citrate, so heed the other reviewers' warnings to avoid any adverse effects.

text: I bought this in order to prevent further kidney stones (ive had 5), and as far as i know, the only drug prescribed for the prevention of calcium oxalate stones is Uricet-K. Its prescribed in "meq"s, and i did the conversion math and now take enough potassium citrate to equal a moderate dose of Uricet-K (it is appx 1 &1/2 tablespoons of potassium citrate; i forgot the meq's). I know this: after a week of taking it, my urine ph went from 4 to 7. Calcium oxalate stones only form in low ph urine, so this is bound to help. Hope it is sufficient to prevent another stone!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
text: Unfortunately, I started taking indapamide at the same time I started taking the rowatinex so it is possible that the indapamide has made the big difference but I don't think so. I think it is maybe a combo of the two or the rowatinex making the bigger difference of the two. I was taking lasik and the dr changed to indapamide instead to help not get kidney stones.When starting I had 5 stones in each kidney  biggest being 9mm. After a year taking 3 rowatinex twice a day and the indapamide, I went for exam and I had none in left kidney and several in right all 5mm or less. I have had totally different readings within a week of each other so it is alway hard to trust the competence of technicians. The 2nd year I went in and only had some tiny tiny stones. I decreased my rowitinex to 2 twice a day because it seemed alot I was taking and it is expensive. 3rd year, I was hoping for no sign of stones but there were several in right and one is 6mm. Did decrease in what I was taking in rowatinex make that difference? Not sure on that.My conclusion is that it must be helping, but it is not an instant acting fix for while you are passing a stone. Over the last 3 years I have had kidney stone pain and I chug water while constantly walking and pacing. The stone usually passed or subsided within an hour of doing this. Before starting  on rowatinex, I was having to have lithotripsy every 6 months to a year.I could stop taking it and only take the indapamide to test this but I don't want to risk getting enormous stones i can't pass to test this theory. Right now I will continue with regimen.I heard about rowatinex because a friend was in Germany and passed a stone and the hospital gave her the rowatinex to prevent stones. Dr.s I have went to have not heard of it, or don't acknowledge it because studies haven't been done to validate it in U.S.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2021
text: You know when you're in a different country that does not have English as the first language, things are going to get complicated when you go to a hospital. Everything is different...language, doctors, processes, labs etc.So, I had left the US for about a year and settled in nicely until one day the pain in my groin, back and stomach just rolled on in like an announced guest.No bueno.Went to the local Farmacia and grabbed some ibuprofen and it helped slightly. Two weeks later I'm still in pain, burning etc. and generally thinking I have an std. Ugh.Well, let's get it over with then right? Headed to the hospital and had the embarrassment of telling them the dreaded statement..."it burns when I pee".Yea, good times.They make me wait an hour or so and then send me to the lab. They take the blood work and send me over to the Urologist. Of course by now I'm dreading the results and then the doc looks up from the paperwork and says everything looks pretty good. I'm like huh?He said in Spanish I have stones. Ahhhhh phew! Relief it was. The ultrasound showed 3 stones and he said maybe head over to get an MRI to check the rest. At least my kidneys looked good, but that didn't stop the pain.The doc sends me out the door with a script for Ketorolac and Rowatinex. I had never heard of either before now.I picked up the pastillas and headed home. Not even 24 hours later I felt relief. Maybe a fluke right?Took the Ketorolac for only 5 days(apparently it's no bueno after that) and the Rowatinex for 2 weeks.I can't tell if one passed or not, but I felt Great!!!Fast forward to a few months later and I started to get that redness and burning again. Went to the Farmacia and knew to grab the Rowatinex and no script was needed. One day later I felt relief again and have been taking 3-4 a day ever since. I'll also add that erections are better and ejaculate has a lot more volume now.Interesting side effect...Take one before every meal and live again without worrying about stones :)

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
text: I come from a long line of stoners.. kidney stoners that is.  It seems to run in our family.  Apparently, my family has a problem with calcium oxalate, calcium phosphate or a combo of the two.  I have spent many miserable days and nights at the local ER because of them.  Now, with so much pain med abuse, the ER's are reluctant to prescribe or give you anything heavy duty that works on the pain.  When you have recurring stones, you start getting a little desperate.  I keep an old bottle of Percocet in my night stand, as I am paranoid about having to suffer through another excruciating bout with these things.  My last attack a few years ago was unbearable and the ER doc wanted to fob me off with Ultram!  I had one kidney stone that was stuck in the bend of my ureter and according to the CT scan, I also had a total of four more stones in my kidneys (two in each).I started researching to see if there was anything out there that could possibly help, besides just diet modification.  I found out about Rowatinex and started taking it.  Knock on wood, I haven't had any more attacks.  I have no idea if the stones passed or not, as nothing ever showed in the strainer.  All I know is the pain eventually subsided and I felt better after taking the Rowatinex.  The instructions say you can take two pills up to three times daily.  I take two or three capsules every night before bedtime now, just as a preventative and haven't had any problems since.  I am thankful to have found this formula!  There are scientific studies that tout it's effectiveness and it has been used in Germany for decades.  It may or may not work for everyone, but if you suffer from stones, you have nothing to lose!  Start taking it and see if it can help you!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2017
text: I was skeptical, but after reading all the positive reviews here on Amazon, I decided to give this a try.  I had a 7x6x4mm stone stuck at the very bottom of my ureter.  I live in the middle of nowhere in the mountains of Guatemala, and the quality of medical care here is iffy at best.  It took them three months to even figure out what was wrong with me, but finally they got a good, clear scan and someone who could read it.  The doctor told me that since the ureter narrows at the junction with the bladder, it was highly unlikely I would ever pass this stone and was doing damage to my kidney by leaving it there.  He wanted to do a ureteroscopy, remove the stone, and put in a stent.  I'd heard awful things about those stents and wasn't too thrilled to get such an invasive procedure done down here in the boonies, so I put him off for weeks.  I heard about Rowatinex from a pharmacist here and decided to stop taking the Flomax (made me dizzy) and try this instead.  I took 2 pills Sunday night, 2 pills 3x on Monday, and passed the stone this morning before I even had a chance to take the pills.  Best part is that I passed it with zero pain!  In fact, if I hadn't been using a strainer, I wouldn't have even known I passed it.  I did not have any side effects at all.  It's pricy, but SO worth it!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2017
text: I have had severe troubles with kidney stones over the years, and the Rowatinex capsules have helped me greatly.  From what I have seen myself, Rowatinex helps reduce the pain of passing stones and helps the body make softer "matrix-type" stones that are easier to pass.  I am a chemist, and I have read the literature about this medication.  The proposed chemistry for how these pills work makes chemical sense.  If you form calcium oxalate-type stones, this medication should make the calcium more soluble in your urine, and greater solubility means less calcium oxalate stone formation and likely softer "matrix-type" stones, if stones do form.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2014
text: My mother has a small dog who has suffered with bladder stones her whole life. Since I'm the family vet tech, I took the little girl everywhere for assessment and suggestions. Diet, medicine, water changes...nothing worked very well and the stones would periodically recur. Also, often when we tested the urine we would get results of crystals in it. At some point, my mom went on an extended trip to Europe to visit relatives and saw a German vet there just for a checkup. The lady suggested this product. Since then, the little dog has had significantly decreased recurrence of crystals in her urine. Important: this product hasn't removed the urinary troubles completely, but it has worked in addition to all the other things we do for her (diet, low Ph water, occasional treatment) to keep the stones from actually forming. It DOES appear to be a useful supplement, but like anything else, I do not believe it is a miracle cure, and I do not know if drinking cranberry daily would have the same effect. However, you try to get a dog to drink cranberry juice (or me, for that matter)! This thing has worked as well as expected, and a bit better. Now, in all fairness, it works for a dog. I have to imagine it works for humans in the same fashion, when combined with sensible diet, but that's MY OWN assessment.

Passed the stone 26 days after stone was found, or 17 days after taking Rowatinex.The stone caught was the same size as the original size detected by CT scan. So Rowatinex apparently did not dissolve the stone. Did it help with passing my stone? I am not 100% sure. A lot of people with painful kidney stones started to drink a lot of fluid while on Rowatinex. Thus, it is difficult to attribute the successful passing of the stone entirely to Rowatinex, at the least.Maybe, Rowatinex is helpful more on prevention, rather than on treating already-formed kidney stones. Good luck to those who suffer from the pains of having a kidney stone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars

text: About 4 weeks ago I had a kidney stone attack and went to the ER.The CT scan showed that I had 5 (4mm) stones. 1 about to make its way out and the others in the left and right kidneys.The ER MD gave me some Flomax to pass the stone that was on its way out, and suggested that I see a urologist to have the other 4 removed.My GF did some research and came across Rowatinex. While skeptical at first, the Amazon reviews helped make my decision easier. If it worked it would be a lot cheaper than having Lithotripsy.I placed the order Sunday afternoon after leaving the ER and received the package in Wednesday's mail.The first few days I took Flomax and Vicodin to keep the pain in check. Once I started on the Rowatinex I felt no more pain and stopped taking the prescription drugs. I never felt any discomfort nor did I feel any stones passing.The latest x-rays taken this week did not show any stones.This stuff is really amazing and saved me a bundle in medical procedure costs.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2013
text: My husband went to the doctor after what seemed like a kidney stone attack. The doctor said he had a kidney infection and some blood in his urine. He took antibiotics for 10 days, but still we saw blood in his urine. On the tenth day he had another more minor attack of pain. During this time, since I've always believed in natural cures, I started looking on Amazon for products to get rid of stones.I found 'stone blasters' with good reviews, but reviewers often said the pain of passing the stones would still be there regardless. Then I saw the Rowatinex reviews and noticed instead reviewers saying stones passed without pain, that they either became very soft or broke apart. I looked into the product some more online and only found good reviews, no bad ones, with no side effects, so this is the one I ordered. Since people used it for eliminating stones but also for prevention of stones, I'll be taking them as well, and also keep some on hand.After a day of taking the Rowatinex my husband was no longer passing blood, he's just finishing his first bottle (2 bottles in the box). I read online he should take them for a month, he's been on 2 three times a day. He hasn't had any more pain, blood, or problems since starting them.Amazon products always come quickly, within a few days, so while waiting I had him start drinking pure apple juice which is supposed to soften stones, which he continues to drink. I gave him a cup of cranberry tea each evening as well (he doesn't like cranberry juice) as cranberry is good for the urinary tract. I've known people who've had kidney stones and the bad pain they experience especially when passing them. From all the reviews I've read now on Rowatinex I'm very confident he won't have another attack. I'm going to also purchase their other product for gallstones.I know blood in the urine is not a good sign and can be scary but I read sometimes it's simply just the stones scraping the duct it's passing through. If the blood returns I'll definitely make sure he goes back to the doctor but I'm thinking this product has taken care of the problem. I wish I could say he actually saw a stone that passed but this is our first experience with kidney stones, we're not sure if he'd notice one 'come out', esp. if this product allows them to pass without pain. All I know is he's had no more pain, no more blood in the urine.2022: I just happened across this review I'd written and can't believe I never did update, after taking this as directed, I think it was 2 bottles, the next day after finishing them I heard a yelp from the bathroom, the stone was out, it was long, narrow and rounded on both ends

text: I found this product after doing alot of research online about kidney stones.  Six years ago, I had a stone surgically removed and passed another with alot of pain.  At that time, the doc told me I had other stones in my kidneys.  No problems until this year when they started to slowly move through my system.  Felt low-grade crappy most of the time instead of the excruciating pain I experienced the first time.  I was able to pass one stone of 5mm within a week of taking Rowatinex and then two months later, passed a 6mm, jagged stone within 48 hours of taking it.  When I examined the jagged stone I was amazed -- I don't know how this nasty thing passed without a trip to the ER and with no pain upon exit.  Anyway, I've tried alot of other home remedies (lemon juice, stone breaker formulas) and this worked for me - it seems to me that it softens the stones so that they can be passed.  I will never travel without having these in my purse.  It's worth a try if you suffer from kidney stones -- heck of alot cheaper than surgery.
